newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: VNU buys 14.9 pct of Blenheim.
newsitem.headline: VNU buys 14.9 pct of Blenheim.

text.p: Dutch publisher NV Verenigd Bezit VNU said on Tuesday it had bought a 14.9 percent stake in Britain's Blenheim Group Plc at a price of about 500 pence per Blenheim share.

"VNU intends to expand this stake in future," the Dutch group said in a statement. It added it did not intend to make a bid for all outstanding shares of the company at short notice, provided there would be no rival bids for the Blenheim shares.
VNU said it had bought the stake from institutional investors.
Earlier today, market sources in London said brokers NatWest had bought a 14.9 percent stake in the British exhibition organiser on behalf of a large European media group.
VNU said the acquisition of the Blenheim stake fitted its policy of international expansion in professional information markets.
This policy should result in a more balanced spread of activities in various countries and in higher profit margins, the Dutch group said.
